articles.description: Borussia Dortmund have been around the Champions League block many more times than Newcastle - and it showed, says chief football writer Phil McNulty.
articles.title: 'Newcastle dealt Champions League reality check'

articles.description: It is an anomaly of the most successful period in Manchester City's European competition history that their main striker has had a goal drought during it.
articles.title: 'People want Haaland to fail - but he will score'

articles.description: Celtic earn their first Champions League point of the season but are denied a long-awaited home group stage victory in a ferocious contest with Atletico Madrid.
articles.title: Atletico prolong Celtic's Champions League win wait

articles.description: Andy Murray is unable to reach his first ATP Tour quarter-final since February after Tomas Martin Etcheverry fights back to win a gruelling contest in Basel.
articles.title: Murray out in Basel after another gruelling contest

articles.description: Liam Delap and Jaden Philogene score Hull City's goals as Wayne Rooney suffers a second straight defeat as Birmingham City boss.
articles.title: Blues beaten by Hull in Rooney's first home game

articles.description: BBC Sport profiles England and Manchester United goalkeeper Mary Earps, one of five nominees for the BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2023 award.
articles.title: Is Earps your Women's Footballer of the Year?

articles.description: Australia's Glenn Maxwell hits a brilliant 40-ball century against the Netherlands, the fastest in World Cup history - watch his best shots.
articles.title: Maxwell hits fastest World Cup hundred - best shots

articles.description: Kylian Mbappe scores as Paris St-Germain go top of Group F with a clinical win over AC Milan in the Champions League.
articles.title: Mbappe scores as PSG cruise past AC Milan

articles.description: England's World Cup squad still has the fight needed to turn their campaign around, says all-rounder Moeen Ali.
articles.title: If anyone can turn World Cup around it is us - Moeen

articles.description: England captain Owen Farrell says the online abuse of team-mate Tom Curry after the flanker reported an alleged on-pitch slur to the referee is "unacceptable".
articles.title: Farrell criticises 'unacceptable' abuse of Curry
